node.title: In-N-Out Burger Rejects Ron DeSantis Pitch to Move to Florida
node.description: The fast food chain got the offer after its San Francisco outlet was closed for refusing to adhere to vaccination proof rules.

node.title: Court hears alleged murder victim's house was unusually clean and smelt like bleach
node.description: The trial of Paul Winston Oatey continues in Adelaide's Supreme Court. He is accused of murdering 53-year-old Darren Perry in December 2019. The teenage girl who the court heard discovered Mr Perry's body in a backyard gives evidence.

node.title: Katherine mask mandate extended after positive COVID-19 wastewater results
node.description: A mask mandate in the town of Katherine is extended for a further 24 hours after positive wastewater results were detected in the region.

node.title: 'Not the smartest thing': Black Caps star breaks hand punching bat, ruled out of T20 World Cup final
node.description: An outburst of frustration leaves Devon Conway nursing a broken hand following New Zealand's semi-final victory over England, ruling the wicketkeeper-batter out of the tournament decider against Australia.

node.title: Shearing on at A and P show with no crowd
node.description: An oink here, a baa baa there, that's the Canty show this year as some competitiors take to the grounds with no spectators due to Covid-19.

node.title: Ocasio-Cortez Isn’t Wavering. Are New Yorkers on Her Side?
node.description: By voting no on the infrastructure bill, Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez set off a fierce debate, including among city residents eager to see the subways improved.

node.title: Graeme Edge, co-founder of The Moody Blues, dies at 80
node.description: Moody Blues frontman Justin Hayward confirms Graeme Edge's death on the group's website. The cause of his death has not been revealed.

node.title: 'Daigou is dying', but Australian products remain popular in China despite trade tensions
node.description: The world's largest online shopping festival sets a new sales record, with Australian products playing a big part, but year-on-year growth falls to its slowest since the event began.

node.title: Prison Won’t Be a Riot for the QAnon Shaman, Jimmy Kimmel Says
node.description: “Prosecutors are recommending 51 months behind bars, after which, he will be remanded into the custody of ‘Dancing With the Stars,’” Kimmel joked.

node.title: Manfred achieves his dream of becoming a physicist — at age 89
node.description: Manfred Steiner, 89, decided to study physics rather than hit around golf balls after retirement — earning his PhD and inspiring others to pursue their ambitions at any age.

node.title: Migration and Experimentation: What Led to Australia’s Coffee Culture
node.description: When Italian migrants arrived after World War II, they helped develop a coffee scene that many now regard as the best in the world.

node.title: American journalist jailed for 11 years in Myanmar
node.description: A court in military-ruled Myanmar sentences US journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years in jail, as he still faces several more serious charges including terrorism.

node.title: The net zero modelling's been released. Here are some of the big assumptions
node.description: To save you spending your Friday night sifting through the government's modelling for its net zero by 2050 plan, here are a few of the key takeaways.

node.title: Flood fallout: Residents still stranded in 'beautiful prison'
node.description: Four months after one of Marlborough's worst storms cut their road access, residents of Kenepuru Sound are still relying on boats for their supplies and livelihoods.

node.title: Police and Customs seize $8 million worth of drugs
node.description: Police seized 17kg of methamphetamine, 5.44kg of MDMA and 1kg of pseudoephedrine after a six-month investigation in Northland.

node.title: Invercargill mayor Sir Tim Shadbolt still storing personal items in council-owned buildings
node.description: Invercargill mayor Sir Tim Shadbolt is still using council-owned buildings for personal storage, three months after he made headlines over the unorthodox arrangement.

node.title: Myanmar court sentences U.S. journalist Danny Fenster to 11 years
node.description: He was convicted of charges including incitement and faces other charges that could bring a life sentence. Fenster is the only foreign journalist convicted of a serious crime since a military coup in May.

node.title: Myanmar Court Sentences American Journalist to 11 Years
node.description: Danny Fenster, who was arrested in May by the military government, was given the maximum sentence on Friday after being convicted on three charges, his employer said.

node.title: Tedesco facing $10,000 fine following NRL investigation into alleged Squid Game incident
node.description: Sydney Roosters captain James Tedesco is issued with a breach notice for "drunken and disorderly behaviour" after he was alleged to have made a racial slur against a woman, citing the Netflix series Squid Game.

node.title: Ethiopia Is Tearing Itself Apart
node.description: The war is spiraling out of control, but peace is still possible.

node.title: APEC: World leaders to meet virtually tonight
node.description: On the formal agenda of the APEC meeting are economic and trade policy, digital innovation, and increased inclusion for sustainability.

node.title: Govt reveals more about Covid-19 cases in Taranaki
node.description: The government has provided more information at today's media conference on how Covid-19 has spread to Taranaki. Watch the briefing here.

node.title: The world's biggest meat processor says Huon Aquaculture is the start of its foray into seafood
node.description: Executives from Brazilian meat processing giant JBS have been in Tasmania surveying its new seafood company Huon Aquaculture ahead of its takeover next Wednesday.

node.title: Victoria to overhaul sexual assault laws to require affirmative consent, outlaw 'stealthing'
node.description: An affirmative consent model will put the focus on the accused person confirming they have received consent, rather than scrutinising the behaviour of the victim-survivor.

node.title: Child rescued from alleged porn operation, as man faces 43 charges
node.description: A child has been rescued, and a man from the Sunshine Coast has been charged with more than 40 child abuse offences, including rape, after a five-day police operation.

node.title: SA storm damage bill tipped to rise as clean-up support announced
node.description: Residents in 24 areas across South Australia will have access to cash to clean-up storm damage after initial assessments show infrastructure and crop losses have already reached $350 million.

node.title: People rescued from floodwaters, dam spills after heavy rain lashes parts of NSW
node.description: Wyangala Dam in the NSW Lachlan Valley overflows and elsewhere, people are rescued from their cars in floodwaters, after heavy rain pounds parts of New South Wales.

node.title: The Manny Diaries
node.description: Chapter one: This job is hard. Chapter two: Leaving it is harder.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 201 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: There are 201 new community cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand today, including 15 in Waikato, one in Taranaki, four in Northland and the rest in Auckland.

node.title: Twelve people arrested, $8 million and 17kg of meth seized in major drug bust
node.description: Police also seized motorbikes, a boat, 5.44kg of MDMA and a kg of pseudoephedrine.

node.title: South Africa's last apartheid president dies at 85
node.description: FW de Klerk was the last white person to lead the nation and was key in the transition to democracy.

node.title: Belarus accused of orchestrating border crisis
node.description: Western nations say Belarus is putting migrants' lives in danger - but Belarus and Russia deny this.

node.title: NPC Championship semi-final: Manawatū v Otago at Palmerston North - Live
node.description: Join us from 7pm for all the action from Central Energy Trust Arena.

node.title: Warehouse hopes strong consumer demand will drive summer sales
node.description: Retailer expecting a rebound after lockdowns and restrictions caused Q1 sales to fall almost 15 percent.

node.title: Government plans to introduce green bonds from 2022
node.description: The government is planning to issue sovereign green bonds from 2022 to help finance the country's low carbon transition.

node.title: China-US climate agreement a game changer, NZ experts say
node.description: New Zealand climate experts say the shock China-US climate cooperation agreement is a game changer that could eclipse outcomes from the COP26 summit, and help clinch agreements there too.

node.title: UK mum doesn't regret refusing COVID-19 vaccine even after baby dies with virus
node.description: She said she'd read "horror stories" about the vaccine online.

node.title: Public service watchdog to investigate Kainga Ora cover-up
node.description: "We need to look into what has happened here and why."

node.title: The resurrection of Swedish House Mafia
node.description: They were the biggest dance act in the world, and then they split up. Here's what happened next.

node.title: Watch: All Blacks star Reece cherishes 'special relationship' with coach Foster before Ireland test
node.description: The Fijian-born winger tells Newshub's Lisette Reymer about his cheeky bond with his boss.

node.title: January 6 committee chair threatens contempt if Meadows doesn't appear
node.description: Hours earlier, the White House notified Meadows' lawyers that the president would not assert executive privilege or immunity over the former congressman's documents and testimony.

node.title: National Party wants investigation into Kāinga Ora
node.description: The National Party is demanding an investigation into what it says is a cover-up and a culture of deceit at Kāinga Ora.

node.title: Police assessing roles covered by Covid-19 vaccine mandate
node.description: Affected police officers will have to have one dose by the end of this month and be fully vaccinated by 14 January to continue in their jobs.

node.title: First wetland prosecution by West Coast Regional Council
node.description: In its first prosecution involving damage to a protected wetland, the West Coast Regional Council took John Cowan to court earlier this year for excavating a 270m-long drain adjoining Department of…

node.title: Covid-19 detected in wastewater sample in Taupō
node.description: A wastewater sample in Taupō has detected Covid-19 and a further sample is currently being analysed.

node.title: Facing a boom without workers, Australian employers deploy bonuses, raises
node.description: People in data management, business intelligence, cybersecurity, talent acquisition can expect salary increases of up to 20 percent thanks to demand, according to recruiter Robert Half.

node.title: 'Concerning': Woman gets car stuck in endangered native bird's nesting site after 'blatant breach' of Auckland's border
node.description: "It’s concerning to see such a blatant breach of wildlife refuge and COVID-19 border rules."

node.title: Merkel describes NZ's zero-COVID strategy as 'very strict' during Q&A with Ardern
node.description: Angela Merkel appeared alongside Jacinda Ardern virtually for the Q&A hosted by Microsoft president Brad Smith.

node.title: Director of Public Health pushes back on concerns hospital understaffing is putting COVID patients at risk
node.description: The New Zealand Nurses Organisation says while there might be enough beds, there isn't enough staff.
